name: biomni-query-uniprot
title: Biomni: Query Uniprot
description: Query UniProt for comprehensive protein sequence and functional information curated from literature and computational analysis.
content:
Overview

Searches UniProt, the world's most comprehensive catalog of protein sequences and functional information. UniProt combines expertly curated data (Swiss-Prot) with automatically annotated sequences (TrEMBL), covering sequence data, protein names, functions, domains, PTMs, interactions, and disease associations for all known proteins.

Input Parameters

  • prompt (string, optional): Natural language query about proteins (e.g., "Find information about BRCA1 protein")
  • endpoint (string, optional): Specific UniProt API endpoint
  • max_results (integer, optional): Maximum number of results to return

Biological Use Case

Fundamental for protein biology research, proteomics analysis, and functional annotation. Researchers use UniProt to identify protein functions, find homologous proteins, map domains and motifs, understand post-translational modifications, discover disease associations, retrieve protein sequences for experimental work, and annotate newly sequenced genomes.

Output

Returns a parameters (uniprot_results.json) containing protein entries with UniProt accessions, protein names, gene names, sequences, functional annotations, domain architecture, subcellular localization, tissue expression, disease associations, post-translational modifications, and extensive cross-references to structural and functional databases.

Category

database
command: rm -rf prod_apps 2>/dev/null || true && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/CamberCloud-Inc/prod_apps.git prod_apps && python3 prod_apps/biomni/database/query_uniprot.py --prompt "${prompt}" --endpoint "${endpoint}" --max_results "${max_results}" -o "${outputDir}"
